result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Marousek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert A. Marousek is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert A. Marousek was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to provide DNA Sample, maintain absolute sobriety, 6 month probation review to be conducted
AODA and comply with any recommendations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Marousek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant discharged from probation on 9-18-17; unpaid supervision fees of $2,160
Letter from Probation Agent Jen Cheaney, Beaver Dam office regarding probation status and request to appear by telephone at the 3-20-15 hearing
Probation review hearing on March 20, 2015 at 09:15 am.
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel
filed by Atty Cross for Atty Kohlwey

Defendant Robert A. Marousek in court, in custody with attorney Randall M. Holtz.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, $268.00 costs and $250.00 DNA Surcharge and provide DNA Sample, maintain absolute sobriety, AODA and comply, 47 days sentence credit, 6 month probation review
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by DA Kohlwey
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: with Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Randy Holtz.
standard felony conditions, not be on premises of any establishment where alcohol is sold for onsight or offsight consumption, not operate motor vehicle

Defendant Robert A. Marousek in court, in custody by video.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $10,000.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, absolute sobriety, not be on premises of any establishment where alcohol is sold for onsight or offsight consumption, not operate motor vehicle, waives time limits for prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 10:20 am.  Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
